title: Monsoon Update – 48-hour storm and heavy rain warning - Times Bull
article_text:
Weather Forecast – The festival of Dhanteras will be celebrated with great pomp and show across the country today. The weather may disrupt the joy and enthusiasm of this festival. From the mountains to the plains, light rain is expected. Snowfall has already begun in the hilly areas of Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, and Kashmir, leading to a drop in temperatures.

Furthermore, temperatures are gradually decreasing in Punjab, Haryana, and Uttar Pradesh. Further drops are expected here. The weather is expected to deteriorate in South India and the Northeast. According to the Indian Meteorological Department, rain is expected in several states. Read the report below to find out which states will experience disruptions to normal life.

UP Weather

According to the Meteorological Department, the weather in Uttar Pradesh is expected to remain very dry for the next five days. No change in the weather is expected until October 20th. Partly cloudy skies are expected in the state. The Meteorological Department has predicted northwesterly winds. Temperatures may also drop here.

Weather in Bihar

According to the Indian Meteorological Department, the weather in Bihar is currently expected to be clear. However, clouds may appear on Diwali. The Meteorological Department has not issued a rain warning. This means that Biharis will be able to celebrate Diwali without any weather problems. Temperatures may drop in several areas, including Patna, Siwan, Saran, Bhojpur, Samastipur, Darbhanga, and Begusarai.

Rainfall is likely in these states

According to the IMD, the monsoon may become active in the Northeast. The IMD has predicted rain in Puducherry, Karaikal, coastal Andhra Pradesh, Rayamasima, South Interior Karnataka, and Kerala. Rainfall is expected here on October 18, 19, 20, and 21, with the intensification of monsoon activity.

Heavy rain is expected in Manipur, Mizoram, and Tripura. Storm warning has been issued in Lakshadweep, Andhra Pradesh, Andaman and Nicobar Islands and Rayamsila.
